posts.content: Hi, My 1967 split bus is missing rear bump stops. I have 2 new ones but unsure of the fitting. Any advice would be greatly appreciated. Thanks.

Not sure I understand the question...sorry if this is grandmother/eggs...they go on the rear axles, and need a fair bit of pressure/leverage to get them onto their bases. You *get* get them on in place but I find it easier to jack the bus a fair and hang the axlee down

Sometimes the bases rot out, in which case you need to weld tabs back on to hold them.

Ben

I noticed the other week that i only have one left on mine!
Haven't really looked at replacing it yet
IRS and slam it instead

I just took my van to a new garage for its mot and they said no bump stops is a mot failure. I've got irs but no where for bump stops to attach. I know - just take it back to the other garage. But is no bump stops an mot failure?

Sent from my GT-I9300 using Tapatalk 2

Never heard that before, most IRS and all SA conversions don't have bump stops.

Maybe he meant, if you have the provision for bump stops and they're not there / damaged = fail.?

How would an MOT man know if the shocks had built in bump stops or not?

I just looked it up on the official mot site.

"Note: a missing bump stop rubber is not a reason for rejection."

http://www.motuk.co.uk/manual_240.htm
Can see the point that you need to check there's some "soft" stop rather than metal to metal.



Sent from my GT-I9300 using Tapatalk 2
I've had a couple of instances where the mot tester didn't know his stuff, safaris and us spec indicators. I went to a different place and stuck with them
